pageContext.description: A half-length portrait of the Duke of Pomerania-Wolgast (1515-1560), facing to his left against a blue background. He has also turned the serious gaze of his blue eyes in this direction, while at the bottom edge of the image his hands grip the hilt of his sword. He is wearing a fur-trimmed cloak over a black tunic embroidered with silver thread.

metadata.title: Philipp I of Pommerania

pageContext.provenance:
- residence of Duke of Pommerania Philip I in Wolgast (?) (listed in the inventory from 1560 among the oil paintings on canvas: 'M. g. H. Herzog Philips zu St. P. – durch Lucas Maler mit Olie 1541') [Mueller 1878, 32]
- Gottfried Christopher Beireis (1730-1809) in Helmstedt - according to the information on an unpreserved piece of paper on the reverse of the painting [Schuchardt 1851 C, 129]
- after 1809 Weimar, Dukes of Weimar [Bethe 1933, 5]
- 1936 acquired by the Pommersches Landesmuseum in Stettin
- during WW2 deposited in the safe of the 'Städtische Sparkasse zu Stettin' [Steinborn 2001, 471]
- after WW2 the painting was lost
- Dorotheum, Vienna, Alte Meister Auct., 20.03.1995
- 1999 Galerie Koller, Zürich [Letter to D. Koepplin from Galerie Koller, 20.07.1999, Koepplin Archive]
- 1999 acquired by the National Museum Szczecin [accessioned on the 17.11.1999]
[Muzeum Narodowe w Szczecinie, revised 2020]
